intro: Cypella lapidosa, commonly known as the stone cypella, is a small, flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Its leaves are usually narrow and grayish-green, while its flowers are small and yellow, often arranged in a cluster. Cypella lapidosa is not widely cultivated but is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological adaptations.
